description: Requests the details of a job for a third party action. Used for partner actions only.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The unique system-generated ID used for identifying the job.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: The clientToken portion of the clientId and clientToken pair used to verify that the calling entity is allowed access to the job and its details.

nested_items.name: jobDetails
nested_items.description: The details of the job, including any protected values defined for the job.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The identifier used to identify the job details in CodePipeline.

nested_items.name: actionTypeId
nested_items.description: Represents information about an action type.

nested_items.name: category
nested_items.description: A category defines what kind of action can be taken in the stage, and constrains the provider type for the action. Valid categories are limited to one of the following values.
Source.
Build.
Test.
Deploy.
Invoke.
Approval.
Compute.

nested_items.name: owner
nested_items.description: The creator of the action being called. There are three valid values for the Owner field in the action category section within your pipeline structure: AWS, ThirdParty, and Custom. For more information, see Valid Action Types and Providers in CodePipeline.

nested_items.name: provider
nested_items.description: The provider of the service being called by the action. Valid providers are determined by the action category. For example, an action in the Deploy category type might have a provider of CodeDeploy, which would be specified as CodeDeploy. For more information, see Valid Action Types and Providers in CodePipeline.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: A string that describes the action version.

nested_items.name: actionConfiguration
nested_items.description: Represents information about an action configuration.

nested_items.name: configuration
nested_items.description: The configuration data for the action.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: pipelineContext
nested_items.description: Represents information about a pipeline to a job worker.

nested_items.name: pipelineName
nested_items.description: The name of the pipeline. This is a user-specified value. Pipeline names must be unique across all pipeline names under an Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the stage.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the action in the context of a job.

nested_items.name: actionExecutionId
nested_items.description: The system-generated unique ID that corresponds to an action's execution.

nested_items.name: pipelineArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the pipeline.

nested_items.name: pipelineExecutionId
nested_items.description: The execution ID of the pipeline.

nested_items.name: inputArtifacts
nested_items.description: The name of the artifact that is worked on by the action, if any. This name might be system-generated, such as 'MyApp', or it might be defined by the user when the action is created. The input artifact name must match the name of an output artifact generated by an action in an earlier action or stage of the pipeline.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The artifact's name.

nested_items.name: revision
nested_items.description: The artifact's revision ID. Depending on the type of object, this could be a commit ID (GitHub) or a revision ID (Amazon S3).

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of artifact in the location.

nested_items.name: s3Location
nested_items.description: The S3 bucket that contains the artifact.

nested_items.name: bucketName
nested_items.description: The name of the S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: objectKey
nested_items.description: The key of the object in the S3 bucket, which uniquely identifies the object in the bucket.

nested_items.name: outputArtifacts
nested_items.description: The name of the artifact that is the result of the action, if any. This name might be system-generated, such as 'MyBuiltApp', or it might be defined by the user when the action is created.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The artifact's name.

nested_items.name: revision
nested_items.description: The artifact's revision ID. Depending on the type of object, this could be a commit ID (GitHub) or a revision ID (Amazon S3).

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of artifact in the location.

nested_items.name: s3Location
nested_items.description: The S3 bucket that contains the artifact.

nested_items.name: bucketName
nested_items.description: The name of the S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: objectKey
nested_items.description: The key of the object in the S3 bucket, which uniquely identifies the object in the bucket.

nested_items.name: artifactCredentials
nested_items.description: Represents an Amazon Web Services session credentials object. These credentials are temporary credentials that are issued by Amazon Web Services Secure Token Service (STS). They can be used to access input and output artifacts in the S3 bucket used to store artifact for the pipeline in CodePipeline.

nested_items.name: accessKeyId
nested_items.description: The access key for the session.

nested_items.name: secretAccessKey
nested_items.description: The secret access key for the session.

nested_items.name: sessionToken
nested_items.description: The token for the session.

nested_items.name: continuationToken
nested_items.description: A system-generated token, such as a CodeDeploy deployment ID, that a job requires to continue the job asynchronously.

nested_items.name: encryptionKey
nested_items.description: The encryption key used to encrypt and decrypt data in the artifact store for the pipeline, such as an Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) key. This is optional and might not be present.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The ID used to identify the key. For an Amazon Web Services KMS key, you can use the key ID, the key ARN, or the alias ARN.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of encryption key, such as an Amazon Web Services KMS key. When creating or updating a pipeline, the value must be set to --KMS'.

nested_items.name: nonce
nested_items.description: A system-generated random number that CodePipeline uses to ensure that the job is being worked on by only one job worker. Use this number in an  AcknowledgeThirdPartyJob request.
